TIL of the Master Sommelier exam, one of the hardest professional exams in the world. Among some of the descriptors Master sommelier hopefuls have used to describe wine are "cat piss", "fresh cut garden hose", and "a freshly opened can of tennis balls".
Wine tasting is essentially an exercise of who can come up with the best similes.

WRITING.TEXT:
How the language law uses and its status in society affects how we, as people and as political subjects, make sense of the world. It's not about the views one holds, but about *how the person herself is created as a function of the law*. Hope I'm making sense to y'all here.
This receives extensive treatment in academia, but I wonder whether this will be something that laypeople will actually contend with. I really doubt it.

One of the first things that happen is that your friend group changes *drastically* after you leave high school. You'll find out that some people are only your friends because you see them five days a week.

TIL that though there are around 20 species of armadillo in the world, only two species can roll into a ball. They are the Southern Three-banded Armadillo (Tolypeutes matacus) and the Brazilian Three-banded Armadillo (Tolypeutes tricinctus).

WRITING.TEXT:
So I had just immigrated to America from [lol guess where]. My mother and I settled in an Atlanta exurb (I think I read it was the most backwards city in America at some point?), and I was enrolled in the local elementary school.
Two weeks in, my 4th grade class watches a video on the digestive system. We get to the point where the feces makes its way through the intestine. All of a sudden, this girl gets my attention. She says "You see that?", pointing to the shit: "That's you."
Still hurts to this day, a decade and a half later.
